task.summary: Default task
new branch for testing
attempts at getting jasmine to play ball, using standalone jasmine download in order to avail of specrunner
attempts at getting jasmine to play ball, using standalone jasmine download in order to avail of specrunner
// below were from electrons test package.json

have imported the test files from electron https://github.com/atom/electron I converted the coffeescript to javascript using npm package coffee -c *.coffee I tested each test against the native npm test afforded by this framework there are 121 failures and 70 tests which have no assertions, so there is no way to know if they are passing
updating readme with provenance
rewriting the readme
writing gitignore correctly
attempts at getting jasmine to play ball, using standalone jasmine download in order to avail of specrunner

borrowing the fixtures from CSVlint to have a supply of local files relevant to USP of this project, however I am adding them to the gitignore for now because a git warning is thrown regarding the fixutre CSVs that use CRLF line breaks

formatting change to main to make loadData function more legible to provide a solution for the panel which can dispaly csvlint.io API results a div has been implemented, rather than employing a full blown panel module css file created to handle formatting of panel and editor pane known issues: conflicts with the handontable CSS, notably not being able to employ scroll: overflow
amending hot.js to change eventListener to the editor panel only to prevent errors when right clicking repsonse DIV
mystery as to how to integrate jquery
writing small functions to determine the filetype opened by application
successfully detect different files
building skeleton for schema editor
changing origin of eventListener at this point because it will trigger javascript errors whenever a rightclick occurs on part of the window that does not contain the handsontable
trying to get out of merge quagmire
change of eventListenerOrigin necessary here as currently errors are triggered by right clicking on any part of the window that isn't a handsontable object
adding CSS
rough wireframe of where things should open
code prepped for experimental introduction of editors from elsewhere

tidy json editor incorporated from https://github.com/josdejong/jsoneditor/ - could perhaos also be loaded as bower module known issue - opening a schema or a csv causes the entire window to lose state, and the CSV and schema files will get lost in memory
editor controller - currently need a better failing mechanism when a schema doesn't load
resolving conflicts to get up to date with import Excel amendments
an ongoing battle with CSS and not fully implemented bootstrap
changes made to include bootstrap and organise the various divs-as-panels

a very down and dirty (DOM manipulation all the way down) employment of the tidy JSON viewer & editor, worth noting that I have taken the save function logic out of this script, need to check if this is the protocol for electron & IPC & renderer separation of concerns
including bootstrap JS in this view
new dependencies

TL;DR some new methods and refactors of existing methods to account for using an inline JSON editor for editing schemas, may be deprecated due to being user unfriendly/daunting feature
loadElements function has been created to counter logic of creating window everytime a file is loaded this change has been necessary because schema and csv are loaded in same window, if schema generation becomes a background task then this change could be reverted
saveSchema method written to handle saving JSON files - currently contradicts how IPC has been separated to date this method employs path to auto suggest the name of the csv as a name for the JSON schema being saved
adding loadschema to menu
adding saveSchema to menu,but this seems very verbose
button save function removed
integrating functionality where open csv triggers a new window, and open schema adds an element to existing window
the json schema editor can be silently toggled on and off by omitting or including the JS file per line 49
